other_tests.findings: Light microscopy showed normal glomeruli, occasional tubules with eosinophilic necrotic debris, and tubular epithelial cells with golden brown, refractile pigments positive for iron stain. Electron microscopy showed unremarkable ultrastructural features of glomeruli. The final report of renal biopsy was acute tubular necrosis (ATN) with hemosiderin deposition.
Led to the final diagnosis of paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH).
